description.div:
The
Eclipse Persistence Services Project (EclipseLink)
project's goal is to deliver a comprehensive Java persistence framework. EclipseLink will focus on providing leading edge support, including advanced feature extensions, for the dominant persistence standards for each target data source.

section.name: Getting Started
section.description: EclipseLink offers persistence services to access data in various formats and data storage solutions. Select the component that addresses your needs and learn how to get started.

section.name: Object-Relational Persistence using JPA
section.em: EclipseLink JPA offers support for mapping Java classes to a relational schema with an easy to use API for query and transaction processing.

section.name: Object-XML Binding using MOXy
section.em: EclipseLink MOXy offers support for binding an existing or generated Java classes to an XML schema so application code can efficiently integrated XML.

section.name: Service Development with Service Data Objects
section.em: EclipseLink SDO provides the support for developing DataObject models for Service integration.

section.name: Web Service access to relational databases
section.em: EclipseLink DBWS enables the rapide generation of Web Services to access relational data.

section.name: Non-Relational Persistence
section.em: EclipseLink EIS provides support for integrating non-relational systems using JCA resource adapters.
